title: Canada dances
creator_contributor_role: National Film Board of Canada, production company
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Canada - Social life and customs
Music & Performing Arts/Indians of North America - Canada - Dances
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Sociology, Rural
description: Episode of Series "Canada carries on". The film relates dancing, both as relaxation and expression, to the traditional and economic environment of the Canadian people. The influence of social conditions on dance forms is demonstrated in a survey which ranges from Indian religious dances, the national and folk dances of pioneers and settlers, the social square dances of rural communities, to the mechanistic individualism of modern jive. Narrated by David Catton.
